content.title: Cystic Adventitial Disease
content.summary: Cystic adventitial disease (CAD) is a rare non-atherosclerotic condition where mucin-containing cysts form in the adventitia of arteries, most commonly the popliteal artery, causing extrinsic compression and claudication in young patients.
content.definition: A rare non-atherosclerotic vascular condition characterized by the accumulation of mucoid material within cysts in the adventitial layer of arteries, most commonly affecting the popliteal artery and causing intermittent claudication

developmental.description: Mucin-secreting cells from adjacent joint incorporated during development
developmental.support: Connection to joint capsule often found

synovial.support: Fluid similar to synovial fluid, joint connections identified

repetitive_trauma.description: Microtrauma leads to degeneration and cyst formation

symptoms.classic: Intermittent claudication in young patient without risk factors
symptoms.variability: Symptoms may vary with joint position (flexion worsens)
symptoms.progression: May progress to rest pain or acute ischemia if thrombosis

physical_findings.pulses: May be normal at rest; diminish with knee flexion

diagnosis.suspicion: Young claudicant without atherosclerotic risk factors

findings: High T2 signal cyst adjacent to artery
Connection to joint may be visible

cyst_excision.description: Complete excision of cyst with preservation of artery

cyst_evacuation.indication: May be used for simple cysts

arterial_reconstruction.indication: Thrombosed artery, severe stenosis, incomplete excision not possible

endovascular.rationale: Disease is extrinsic; does not address underlying cyst

prognosis.with_treatment: Excellent if complete cyst excision achieved
prognosis.recurrence: 10-20% if incomplete excision or aspiration alone

content.statement: Cystic Adventitial Disease is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Rare-Syndromes that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Cystic Adventitial Disease helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Cystic Adventitial Disease include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Cystic Adventitial Disease.

definition.@value: Non-atherosclerotic condition with mucoid cysts in arterial adventitia causing compression and claudication

medicalCode.description: Other specified disorders of arteries and arterioles

learning_objectives: Define cystic adventitial disease and its pathophysiological theories
Recognize clinical presentation in young claudicant without risk factors
Distinguish from popliteal artery entrapment syndrome
clinical_pearls: Young claudicant without risk factors = think CAD or PAES
Ishikawa sign: pulse disappears with knee flexion
Scimitar sign on angiography = curved eccentric narrowing
Complete cyst excision preferred; aspiration has high recurrence
Stenting not recommended - disease is extrinsic
